title: Can unsecured debt , credit cards and personal loans, be used by the creditors to put a lien on my property.
question: my wife and i have an unsecrued debt, like credit cards and personal loan. we stopped paying our unsecured credit cards and personal loans and we are kind of worried that they might or will lien it againts our property. ONE OF OUR UNSECURED CREDIT CARD AND ALSO OUR UNSECURED PERSONAL LOAN THAT WE ALSO STOPPED PAYING IS WITH THE SAME BANK AS OUR MORTGAGE. we are always on time paying our mortgage and no late or miss payment. will this bank go after our property and put a lien on it since we still have equity left on our property..... will our other credits card company can also put a lien on our property.
answers:
Disclaimer: The materials provided below are informational and should not be relied upon as legal advice.

Yes, the creditors may place liens under certain circumstances. If your contract with creditor allows them a right of offset, they may satisfy the moneys you owe them from deposits you may have with them. Also, they may bring lawsuits and place attachment liens or judgment liens on your assets. You should consult your own lawyers to protect your legal rights.
